perturbation.original_text: 1.4 Additional Considerations (a) Pricing. Franchisor and Franchisee shall agree upon and decide the locations at which the Smaaash Centres shall be set up within the Territory. The Franchisee shall not be entitled to set up any new Smaaash Centres without consulting with, and obtaining the prior written consent of Smaaash.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.4 Additional Considerations (a) Pricing. The Franchisee shall be entitled to set up any new Smaaash Centres with minimal consultation with Smaaash.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the requirement for prior written consent for new Smaaash Centre locations, this change contradicts the overall intent of the franchise agreement, which emphasizes Franchisor control. Later sections may still reference the need for Franchisor approval on certain matters, creating an internal inconsistency.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Grant of License in the Trademarks 3.1 License. Subject to the terms of this Agreement (including all obligations to first obtain Franchisor's written approval), Franchisor hereby grants to Franchisee the right to use the Trademarks (the details of which are set out in Exhibit A to this Agreement) (including sub-licensing this right to third party franchisees with the approval of Franchisor), on a royalty-free basis, for the purpose of operating and promoting the Smaaash Centres in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Grant of License in the Trademarks 3.1 License. Subject to the terms of this Agreement, Franchisor hereby grants to Franchisee the right to use the Trademarks on a royalty-free basis, for the purpose of operating and promoting the Smaaash Centres in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'including all obligations to first obtain Franchisor's written approval', the agreement now grants the Franchisee trademark rights, and sub-licensing rights, without explicitly requiring prior Franchisor approval which goes against what the contract details. Later sections may still reference the Franchisee needing Franchisor approval for trademarks, which would create an internal contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Best Efforts. (a) Franchisee shall exercise its best efforts to effectively market, promote, and publicise the Smaaash Centres throughout the Territory. Franchisee shall also be obligated to identify suitable locations to set up the Smaaash Centres. Franchisee shall comply with, and ensure that the third party sub-franchisees comply with the standards prescribed by Franchisor (as provided in the operating manuals which shall be shared by Franchisor with Franchisee) with respect to the services, products and operations of the Smaaash Centres and shall operate the Smaaash Centres in strict conformity with such standards and specifications as Franchisor may from time to time prescribe to Franchisee.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Best Efforts. (a) Franchisee shall exercise its best efforts to effectively market, promote, and publicise the Smaaash Centres throughout the Territory. Franchisee shall also be obligated to identify suitable locations to set up the Smaaash Centres. Franchisee shall operate the Smaaash Centres in strict conformity with their discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the Franchisee's obligation to comply with standards prescribed by the Franchisor and the operating manuals, the agreement gives the Franchisee leeway. This creates a contradiction since other sections of the contract state that Franchisee is obligated to be compliant with the Franchisor.
